item.title: Deb add a quote by Rebecca Solnit
item.description: "For me, childhood roaming was what developed self-reliance, a sense of direction and adventure, imagination, a will to explore, to be able to get a little lost and then figure out the way back." -- Rebecca Solnit

item.title: Deb add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "Her mind was an hotel where facts came and went like transient lodgers, without leaving their address behind, and frequently without paying for their board." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Deb add a quote by A.S. Byatt
item.description: "He had said she was provocative; so she was, she needed to prove she was there to be seen; but the proof always, contradictorily, drove her to further uncertain agony of guilt and self-distaste." -- A.S. Byatt

item.title: Deb add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Deb add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "Silence may be as variously shaded as speech." -- Edith Wharton
